results.title: When the flood comes
results.brief_description: The Newcastle floods of 2007 have caused Djibril Ly to reflect on growing up in Mauritania in West Africa. He recalls the devestation of flooding and how this has helped him to prepare for similar events in Australia.

results.title: When a fire comes to you
results.brief_description: When the threat of fire hit Lydia Romari’s family, they adopted their fire plan and stayed safe. Unfortunately, it doesn’t erase the frustration, anxiety and horror of the Black Saturday bushfires that devestated much of the Yarra Ranges region in Victoria in 2009.

results.title: Ready and able
results.brief_description: Members of the CFA provide practical advice on how to prepare for and survive a major catastrophe like a bushfire or a flood. These interviews were conducted in light of the tragic Black Saturday bushfires in February 2009.

results.title: Home again
results.brief_description: Kat Hay provides her account of the Newcastle Floods of 2007, from the realisation that it was not an ordinary day to the feelings associated with returning home after everything was destroyed.

results.title: Fishermen
results.creator_credit: Guy L. Cote and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Should he choose to stay boss of his own boat and hope for better catches, or seek a job in commercial fishing, trading independence for a more certain income? This film is about the choice that faces many of Canada’s east-coast fishermen. (Awards: Berlin; Bloemfontein; Columbus)

results.title: Fisherman's fall
results.creator_credit: Robert Nichol, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: One of Canada’s best known fly-fishermen, essayist Roderick Haig-Brown, demonstrates the art of salmon fishing in the Campbell River of northern Vancouver Island. The film, like the fisherman, has eyes for more than the river’s surface. The camera looks below, showing what the fish sees and the fisherman senses. A film of solitude and of harmony with nature. (Awards: Toronto; Detroit; Novi Sad)

results.title: Out
results.brief_description: Initially following the trajectory of a car which is taking ‘The Girl’ (Celia Ireland), out to a social function, this short film allows the viewer to be privy to the thought processes of what it means to go “out”. The girl ponders issues such as timing, kissing, a no sex policy, being interesting, making an impression, pit stops, and identifying the highlight of the evening. Cast also includes John Polson and Suzy Dougherty.

results.title: First time afloat
results.creator_credit: Maurice Dybeck, Peter Halket and Explorer Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Canoecraft”.
Intended for the complete newcomer to canoeing, this films shows the importance of never canoeing without a lifejacket. Shows methods of getting afloat, simple paddling strokes, and how to choose a route. Also shows how easy it is to escape from a capsize, and deals with how to land both canoeist and canoe. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Maurice Dybeck, Peter Halket and Explorer Films

results.title: Canoeing safely
results.creator_credit: Maurice Dybeck, Peter Halket and Explorer Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Canoecraft”.
Underlines some of the dangers which abound on almost every river and canal and shows ways of taking sensible precautions to avoid these dangers. Topics covered include life; hazards; paddling skills; an ‘H’ rescue; canoe buoyancy aids; weirs; capsize drill; stopper waves; emergency packs; bridges and a ‘T’ rescue.
